wikipedia_page.main: Ernest Harold Jones (1877-1911) was a British artist and excavator. He contracted tuberculosis and in 1904 he decided to go to Egypt to relieve his symptoms. He worked with John Garstang, of Liverpool, from 1904–07 and then for Theodore M. Davis and Emma Andrews from 1907-11. He died of tuberculosis in Luxor, Egypt, in March 1911.
